intro: Dammara hypoleuca, commonly known as the white dammara, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a glossy surface. Dammara hypoleuca is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
